result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael David Jones Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay supervision fees. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, any cash bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

-No contact with Santierra L. unless approved by the agent.
-3rd Party contact solely for the purpose of time with child as approved by the agent. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Provide DNA Sample.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael David Jones in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Michael David Jones in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

 Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Santierra L. unless approved by the agent.
-3rd Party contact solely for the purpose of time with child as approved by the agent. 
-Obtain/maintain employment/schooling or combination of both.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay supervision fees. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, any cash bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures.  
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and upon motion of the state, Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 

  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

 
Court advised that the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Case adjourned to branch 21 for Sentencing.

2nd Call:  State files Amended Criminal Complaint charging Count 2 as Disorderly Conduct,  Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 973.055(1) , a Class B misdemeanor.
